doctrine_source: TCCC(UK) ASM Aide Memoire Mar 25 / Trainer Manual v1.1 May 25

master.name: Master Drill
master.description: Initial assessment and care under fire

nodes.title: SAFE
nodes.prompt: Before approaching: Shout, Assess, Find cover, Evaluate threats
actions: SHOUT - Call for help, alert team
ASSESS - Evaluate the scene for threats
advice: SAFE ensures rescuer safety before casualty approach

nodes.title: MASTER DRILL
nodes.prompt: Are you under effective enemy fire?

nodes.title: CARE UNDER FIRE
nodes.prompt: Return fire and take cover. Direct casualty to cover if able.
warnings: Win the firefight first

nodes.title: BLEEDING CHECK
nodes.prompt: Is there severe limb bleeding? (Self or buddy)

nodes.title: APPLY TOURNIQUET
nodes.prompt: Apply tourniquet HIGH and TIGHT on limb

nodes.title: CONSCIOUSNESS
nodes.prompt: Is the casualty conscious?

nodes.title: POSITION CASUALTY
nodes.prompt: Roll casualty FACE DOWN if accessible

nodes.title: MOVE TO COVER
nodes.prompt: Move casualty to cover when tactically safe

nodes.title: CASUALTY COUNT
nodes.prompt: Are there multiple casualties?

nodes.title: TRIAGE
nodes.prompt: Perform 10-second triage on each casualty. Use walking, talking, bleeding, breathing sequence. Mark and move on.

nodes.title: TRIAGE STEP 1
nodes.prompt: Can the casualty WALK?

nodes.title: P3 - DELAYED
nodes.prompt: Mark casualty as P3

nodes.title: TRIAGE STEP 2
nodes.prompt: Is the casualty BREATHING?

nodes.title: DEAD
nodes.prompt: Mark casualty as DEAD

nodes.title: TRIAGE STEP 3
nodes.prompt: Does the casualty RESPOND to commands?

nodes.title: P2 - URGENT
nodes.prompt: Mark casualty as P2

nodes.title: P1 - IMMEDIATE
nodes.prompt: Mark casualty as P1

nodes.title: MORE CASUALTIES?
nodes.prompt: Are there more casualties to triage?

nodes.title: SELECT CASUALTY
nodes.prompt: Select casualty to treat (P1 first)

nodes.title: ALL TREATED
nodes.prompt: All casualties have received initial MARCH assessment

nodes.title: MASSIVE BLEEDING
nodes.prompt: Assess for life-threatening bleeding. Visual sweep of limbs and junctions.

nodes.title: LIMB BLEEDING
nodes.prompt: Is there life-threatening LIMB bleeding?

nodes.title: TOURNIQUET
nodes.prompt: Apply tourniquet HIGH and TIGHT

nodes.title: BLEEDING CHECK
nodes.prompt: Is bleeding controlled?

nodes.title: 2ND TOURNIQUET
nodes.prompt: Apply second tourniquet proximal to first
actions: Apply 2nd tourniquet above the first (closer to body)
warnings: Two tourniquets may be needed for large limbs

nodes.title: JUNCTIONAL BLEEDING
nodes.prompt: Is there junctional bleeding? (Groin, axilla, neck)

nodes.title: WOUND PACKING
nodes.prompt: Pack wound and apply direct pressure
actions: Pack tightly with gauze (haemostatic if available)
warnings: NEVER use haemostatic agents in chest or abdominal cavity - internal damage risk

nodes.title: PELVIC INJURY
nodes.prompt: Suspected pelvic fracture?

nodes.title: PELVIC BINDER
nodes.prompt: Apply pelvic binder at greater trochanters

nodes.title: M - COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: Massive bleeding assessment complete

nodes.title: CONSCIOUSNESS CHECK
nodes.prompt: Shake and shout. Is the casualty responsive?
advice: Check consciousness before proceeding to Airway

nodes.title: AIRWAY
nodes.prompt: Is the casualty CONSCIOUS and talking?

nodes.title: SPINAL INJURY?
nodes.prompt: Is spinal injury suspected? (Mechanism, neck pain, neurological signs)

nodes.title: CASUALTY POSITION
nodes.prompt: Is the casualty face down or is the airway obstructed?

nodes.title: OPEN AIRWAY
nodes.prompt: Head tilt, chin lift. Check for obstruction.

nodes.title: BREATHING CHECK
nodes.prompt: Is the casualty breathing? (Look, listen, feel 10 sec)

nodes.title: RECOVERY POSITION
nodes.prompt: Place in 3/4 prone (recovery) position. Record AVPU level.
actions: Upper leg bent at knee for stability
Lower arm extended, upper arm supporting head
advice: 3/4 prone protects airway and allows drainage

nodes.title: NOT BREATHING
nodes.prompt: Reposition airway and reassess. Clear visible obstruction if present.
warnings: Limited options without advanced equipment

nodes.title: CPR DECISION
nodes.prompt: Still not breathing after airway repositioning. Is the area SECURE (not under fire)?
warnings: NEVER attempt CPR under effective enemy fire

nodes.title: CPR NOT SAFE
nodes.prompt: Under fire + not breathing = DEAD. CPR would endanger rescuer.
warnings: Doctrine: Under fire, not breathing = mark DEAD and move on

nodes.title: CPR RESOURCES
nodes.prompt: Do you have resources for CPR? (Time, personnel, no other P1 casualties)
warnings: Consider: other casualties, tactical situation, evacuation timeline

nodes.title: BASIC LIFE SUPPORT
nodes.prompt: Commence CPR if resources allow
warnings: Tactical situation dependent
Resource intensive
Stop if: professional takes over, you are exhausted, or casualty recovers

nodes.title: A - COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: Airway assessment complete

drill_4.name: Drill 4: Suspected Spinal Injury
drill_4.description: Airway management with spinal precautions - TM Section 5.4

nodes.title: SPINAL PRECAUTIONS
nodes.prompt: Maintain manual in-line stabilisation throughout assessment
actions: Place hands either side of head
warnings: Do NOT use head tilt - risk of spinal cord damage

nodes.title: JAW THRUST
nodes.prompt: Open airway using jaw thrust manoeuvre only
actions: Place fingers behind angles of jaw
Use thumbs to open mouth if needed
advice: Jaw thrust opens airway without moving the spine

nodes.title: BREATHING CHECK
nodes.prompt: Is the casualty breathing? (Look, listen, feel for up to 10 seconds)

nodes.title: NASOPHARYNGEAL AIRWAY
nodes.prompt: Insert NPA to maintain airway. NPA preferred over OPA for spinal injury.
actions: Advance gently along floor of nose
Secure with safety pin if required
warnings: NPA preferred - OPA may cause vomiting and spine movement

nodes.title: NOT BREATHING
nodes.prompt: Maintain jaw thrust and reassess. Clear any visible obstruction.
warnings: Maintain spinal precautions
Do NOT perform head tilt

nodes.title: CPR DECISION
nodes.prompt: Still not breathing. Is the area SECURE (not under fire)?
warnings: NEVER attempt CPR under effective enemy fire

nodes.title: CPR NOT SAFE
nodes.prompt: Under fire + not breathing = DEAD. CPR would endanger rescuer.
warnings: Doctrine: Under fire, not breathing = mark DEAD and move on

nodes.title: CPR RESOURCES
nodes.prompt: Do you have resources for CPR? (Time, personnel, no other P1 casualties)
warnings: Consider: other casualties, tactical situation, evacuation timeline

nodes.title: CPR WITH SPINAL PRECAUTIONS
nodes.prompt: Commence CPR maintaining spinal alignment
warnings: Maintain spinal precautions throughout
Stop if: professional takes over, you are exhausted, or casualty recovers

nodes.title: A - COMPLETE (SPINAL)
nodes.prompt: Airway managed with spinal precautions

drill_5.name: Drill 5: Face Down / Obstructed Airway
drill_5.description: Log roll and airway clearance - TM Section 5.5

nodes.title: OBSTRUCTED AIRWAY
nodes.prompt: Casualty face down or airway obstructed. Must access airway.
advice: Log roll required to assess and clear airway

nodes.title: LOG ROLL
nodes.prompt: Log roll casualty to access airway
actions: Roll casualty towards you as one unit
advice: Control the roll - do not twist spine

nodes.title: VISIBLE OBSTRUCTION?
nodes.prompt: Is there visible obstruction in the airway?

nodes.title: CLEAR OBSTRUCTION
nodes.prompt: Remove visible obstruction from airway
actions: Open mouth (finger sweep only if object visible)
warnings: Only remove VISIBLE obstruction
Do NOT perform blind finger sweep

nodes.title: RESPIRATORY
nodes.prompt: Expose and assess chest. Look for wounds, asymmetry.

nodes.title: CHEST WOUND
nodes.prompt: Is there an open/penetrating chest wound?

nodes.title: SEAL ENTRY WOUND
nodes.prompt: Apply chest seal to ENTRY wound.

nodes.title: CHECK EXIT WOUND
nodes.prompt: Check back/sides for EXIT wound. Is there an exit wound?
warnings: CRITICAL: Missing exit wound seal causes tension pneumothorax

nodes.title: SEAL EXIT WOUND
nodes.prompt: Apply chest seal to EXIT wound.
actions: Seal exit wound same as entry

nodes.title: POSITION CASUALTY
nodes.prompt: Position casualty with wounded side DOWN if possible.
advice: Wounded side down allows uninjured lung to expand fully

nodes.title: TENSION PNEUMOTHORAX
nodes.prompt: Signs of tension? (Increasing distress, tracheal deviation, absent sounds)

nodes.title: R - COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: Respiratory assessment complete

nodes.title: NEEDLE DECOMPRESSION
nodes.prompt: Are you trained for needle decompression?

nodes.title: DECOMPRESS
nodes.prompt: 2nd ICS, mid-clavicular line. 14G needle 8cm+. Note time.
warnings: Only if signs clearly indicate tension

nodes.title: CIRCULATION
nodes.prompt: Assess for signs of shock

nodes.title: SHOCK ASSESSMENT
nodes.prompt: Check for shock signs (select all present):

nodes.title: SHOCK PRESENT?
nodes.prompt: Based on assessment, are shock signs present?

nodes.title: MANAGE SHOCK
nodes.prompt: Treat shock
warnings: NO food or drink - especially if abdominal injury suspected

nodes.title: C - COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: Circulation assessment complete

nodes.title: HEAD INJURY
nodes.prompt: Assess consciousness level (AVPU). Check pupils.

nodes.title: AVPU
nodes.prompt: Consciousness level:

nodes.title: HEAD COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: Head injury assessment complete

drill_10.name: Drill 10: Burns
drill_10.description: Burns assessment and management - TM Section 5.10

nodes.title: BURNS ASSESSMENT
nodes.prompt: Are there burns present?

nodes.title: AIRWAY BURN?
nodes.prompt: Signs of airway burn? (Facial burns, singed nasal hair, soot in mouth/nose, hoarse voice)

nodes.title: AIRWAY BURN - URGENT
nodes.prompt: Airway burns cause delayed swelling. EARLY EVACUATION ESSENTIAL.
warnings: CRITICAL: Airway burns = P1 - IMMEDIATE evacuation
Swelling may obstruct airway within hours

nodes.title: STOP THE BURNING
nodes.prompt: Remove casualty from burn source. Stop the burning process.
actions: Move casualty away from heat source
Do NOT remove clothing stuck to burn
warnings: Do NOT remove clothing adhered to skin

nodes.title: BURN TYPE
nodes.prompt: What type of burn?

nodes.title: CHEMICAL BURN
nodes.prompt: Chemical burn - remove contamination
actions: Irrigate with copious water for 20+ minutes
Do NOT neutralise with other chemicals
warnings: Contaminated clothing continues burning tissue

nodes.title: PHOSPHORUS BURN
nodes.prompt: White phosphorus burn - keep wet at all times
actions: Do NOT let phosphorus dry out
Remove visible particles with wet forceps
warnings: CRITICAL: Dry phosphorus reignites in air
Keep continuously wet until surgical care

nodes.title: COOL BURNS
nodes.prompt: Cool burns with clean cool water for twenty minutes
actions: Cool for 20 minutes minimum if possible
Do NOT use ice or iced water - causes frostbite
warnings: Do NOT use ice - causes frostbite on damaged tissue
Watch for hypothermia especially in large burns

nodes.title: COVER BURNS
nodes.prompt: Cover burns with cling film or clean non-fluffy dressing
actions: Apply cling film lengthways (not wrapped around)
Do NOT apply creams or lotions
advice: Cling film protects, reduces pain, allows assessment

nodes.title: ASSESS %TBSA
nodes.prompt: Estimate total body surface area affected using Rule of 9s
advice: Head: 9%, Each arm: 9%, Chest: 18%, Back: 18%, Each leg: 18%, Groin: 1%

nodes.title: BURNS COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: Burns assessment complete

nodes.title: HYPOTHERMIA PREVENTION
nodes.prompt: Prevent heat loss in ALL casualties

nodes.title: H - COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: MARCH sequence complete

nodes.title: MARCH COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: What next?

nodes.title: CASREP
nodes.prompt: Complete Casualty Report. Confirm grid reference/location coordinates.
advice: Grid reference is critical - MEDEVAC cannot find you without accurate location

nodes.title: CASREP COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: CASREP ready. Export or continue to pre-evac care.

nodes.title: PRE-EVAC CARE
nodes.prompt: Continue monitoring. Regular MARCH reassessment.

nodes.title: TOURNIQUET CHECK
nodes.prompt: Is there a tourniquet applied?

nodes.title: TOURNIQUET TIME
nodes.prompt: Has the tourniquet been in place for MORE than 2 hours?

nodes.title: DO NOT REMOVE
nodes.prompt: Tourniquet in place >2 hours. DO NOT REMOVE - risk of reperfusion injury and death.
warnings: CRITICAL: Removing tourniquet after 2+ hours releases toxins into circulation
Leave tourniquet in place until surgical care available

nodes.title: CONVERSION CRITERIA 1/4
nodes.prompt: Is the casualty in SHOCK? (Pale, cold, rapid pulse, altered consciousness)

nodes.title: KEEP TOURNIQUET
nodes.prompt: Casualty in shock. DO NOT attempt conversion - cardiovascular collapse risk.
warnings: Shock + tourniquet removal = cardiovascular collapse

nodes.title: CONVERSION CRITERIA 2/4
nodes.prompt: Is there AMPUTATION or mangled extremity?

nodes.title: KEEP TOURNIQUET
nodes.prompt: Amputated or mangled extremity. Tourniquet must remain in place.
warnings: Amputation requires permanent tourniquet until surgical care

nodes.title: CONVERSION CRITERIA 3/4
nodes.prompt: Can you MONITOR the casualty continuously after conversion?

nodes.title: KEEP TOURNIQUET
nodes.prompt: Cannot monitor casualty continuously. Leave tourniquet in place.
warnings: Bleeding may restart - must be able to detect and respond

nodes.title: CONVERSION CRITERIA 4/4
nodes.prompt: Is the tactical situation STABLE? (Not under fire, not about to move)

nodes.title: KEEP TOURNIQUET
nodes.prompt: Tactical situation unstable. Leave tourniquet in place.
warnings: Only convert in stable, controlled environment

nodes.title: TOURNIQUET CONVERSION
nodes.prompt: Attempt conversion to pressure dressing
actions: Apply pressure dressing DISTAL to tourniquet
If bleeding returns: re-tighten tourniquet immediately
If no bleeding: remove tourniquet, maintain pressure
warnings: Be ready to re-tighten immediately

nodes.title: CONVERSION RESULT
nodes.prompt: Was conversion successful?

nodes.title: MONITOR FOR REBLEEDING
nodes.prompt: Conversion successful. MONITOR closely for bleeding return.
warnings: If bleeding restarts: immediately return to Drill 2 (Massive Bleeding)
Check dressing every 5 minutes

nodes.title: BLEEDING RECHECK
nodes.prompt: Has bleeding restarted?
warnings: If bleeding restarts, go immediately to Drill 2

nodes.title: DOCUMENT
nodes.prompt: Document tourniquet status and any conversion attempt.

nodes.title: MONITORING
nodes.prompt: Complete checks:
warnings: If chest seal applied: do NOT place casualty prone - risk of seal dislodgement

nodes.title: REASSESSMENT
nodes.prompt: Any deterioration?

nodes.title: MONITORING COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: Assessment recorded

nodes.title: MIST(AT) HANDOVER
nodes.prompt: Complete MIST(AT) report for casualty handover. Use 24 hour clock for all times.

nodes.title: M - MECHANISM
nodes.prompt: Describe the mechanism of injury - how was the casualty wounded?
advice: IED, GSW, blast, fall, vehicle, etc.

nodes.title: I - INJURY
nodes.prompt: Describe injuries found during assessment
advice: Location, type, severity of each injury

nodes.title: S - SIGNS
nodes.prompt: Report vital signs and AVPU
advice: AVPU level, respiratory status, shock signs, bleeding status

nodes.title: T - TREATMENT
nodes.prompt: List all treatment given with times
advice: Tourniquets, chest seals, airways, medications, etc. with times

nodes.title: MIST COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: MIST(AT) report ready for handover

nodes.title: BASIC LIFE SUPPORT
nodes.prompt: Commence CPR following Resuscitation Council UK guidelines
actions: Use AED as soon as available
warnings: Stop if: professional takes over, you are exhausted, or casualty recovers

nodes.title: BLS COMPLETE
nodes.prompt: Continue CPR until professional help arrives or casualty recovers

TOURNIQUET.name: Tourniquet
TOURNIQUET.doc_prompt: Record tourniquet time - critical for conversion decision

CHEST_SEAL.name: Chest Seal
CHEST_SEAL.doc_prompt: Note side(s) sealed and seal type

NEEDLE_DECOMPRESSION.name: Needle Decompression
NEEDLE_DECOMPRESSION.doc_prompt: Record time and side of decompression

WOUND_PACKING.name: Wound Packing
WOUND_PACKING.doc_prompt: Record wound location and packing material

IV_IO.name: IV/IO Access
IV_IO.doc_prompt: Record site, access type, and fluids given

CPR.name: CPR
CPR.doc_prompt: Record CPR start time and duration

PAIN_RELIEF.name: Pain Relief
PAIN_RELIEF.doc_prompt: Record medication, dose, route and time

pain_relief.title: PAIN RELIEF
pain_relief.description: Administer pain relief (available anytime during MARCH)

prompts.title: AVPU CHECK
prompts.prompt: What is the casualty's AVPU level?

prompts.title: FENTANYL SAFETY
prompts.prompt: Is the casualty Alert or responding to Voice? (A or V on AVPU)

prompts.title: FENTANYL CONTRAINDICATED
prompts.prompt: Casualty P or U on AVPU. DO NOT give fentanyl - respiratory arrest risk.
warnings: CRITICAL: Fentanyl in reduced consciousness = respiratory arrest
Only oral analgesia if casualty can swallow safely

prompts.title: ORAL ANALGESIA
prompts.prompt: Administer oral pain relief if available

prompts.title: IV/IM ANALGESIA
actions: For fentanyl: write F + time on cheek
advice: Mark F and administration time on casualty's cheek to prevent overdose

prompts.title: DEFER ANALGESIA
prompts.prompt: Pain relief deferred - casualty unconscious or airway not secure
